intro: Eurystemon mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican euonym, is a shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, though it is not closely related to them. The plant features small, green, heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruit is a small, round, green berry that turns red when mature. The plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
